title: React Native Essentials
subtitle: Build Native Mobile Apps with JavaScript
description: React Native lets you build mobile applications using JavaScript and React. Write once, run on both iOS and Android with truly native performance.

title: Core Components
content:
React Native provides platform-specific components that map directly to native UI elements:

â€¢ View: Container (like div)
â€¢ Text: Text display (required for all text)
â€¢ ScrollView: Scrollable container
â€¢ FlatList: Optimized list rendering
â€¢ Image: Display images
â€¢ TextInput: Text input fields
â€¢ TouchableOpacity: Touchable elements

These components render native views, ensuring optimal performance.
keyTakeaway: React Native components compile to native platform elements, not web views.

title: React vs React Native
conclusion: React Native uses the same React principles but targets mobile platforms with native components.

title: Your First Component
keyTakeaway: React Native uses native components like View and Text instead of HTML elements.

title: State & Props
content:
React Native uses the same state management as React:

Props (Properties):
â€¢ Pass data from parent to child
â€¢ Immutable within the component
â€¢ Enable component reusability

State:
â€¢ Internal component data
â€¢ Mutable via setState or hooks
â€¢ Triggers re-renders when changed

Example with hooks:
const [count, setCount] = useState(0);

Use props for configuration, state for dynamic data.
keyTakeaway: Props pass data down, state manages internal component data and triggers re-renders.
